programme.desc: Hana Etsuko Dethlefsen features dishes like Japanese Chicken Wings and Chawanmushi for a lovely feast.

programme.title: Bring On The Karbs
programme.desc: Chefs Erica and Josh Karbelnik go head-to-head to see who can come up with the spookiest Halloween meal! Josh makes pumpkin curry. crispy chicken feet. and calf liver. while Erica pumpkin shaped gnocchi. witch hat shaped pasta. and bruschetta with mushroom skulls!

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.desc: Skilled Chef Katie Ardington is excited to introduce her favourite fish, striped sea bass, in this fabulous voyage through the 7 seas of seafood cookery.

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.desc: Chef-host Natalia Machado loves chicken, and who doesn't? Chicken is enjoyed around the world for good reason; it is versatile and reliably delicious!

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.desc: Salad is a wonderful addition to any meal, and sometimes even a meal on its own"... today, the talented Chef Craig Wong shares several of his superior salad ideas.

programme.title: Cook Like A Chef
programme.desc: Snout to tail cooking is Chef Derek Dammann's specialty, in this episode celebrating pork, he cooks everything but the squeal!

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: In this "C" challenge, Chef Robert Jewell cooks up recipes using coconut and crab before combining both into a single recipe. Using sweet coconut, Robert makes a classic dessert -- an irresistible coconut cream pie. He starts with a delectable crunchy graham cracker crust and tops his pie with fluffy whipped cream and toasted coconut flakes. Next, Robert transforms a fresh soft-shell crab into a delicious, spicy, and crunchy dish. The best part? It's fast and easy to make. After soaking the crab in milk, Robert dunks it into a flour-cornmeal mixture and fries it until golden brown. But that's not all, Robert whips up the perfect dipping sauce, using spicy smoked- jalapeno, lime, and...

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: It's all about sesame and scallops in this letter "S" challenge, and host Theresa Visintin has some appetizing ideas up her sleeve. First, she shows us how to make scallop cassoulet, a simple recipe that can be cooked even faster than it can eaten! Theresa browns the tender scallops in delicious bacon fat and then bakes it on a bed of creamy kidney beans. Next, Theresa uses sesame seeds to create a zesty sauce for a take-out favourite, made in your very own kitchen - noodles! For her final recipe, our culinary host combines sesame and scallops, creating a juicy, crunchy masterpiece.

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Making dishes with the letter “W” could be seen as a real challenge, but Chef Lauren Gulyas has got it covered. Choosing water chestnut and watercress as her star ingredients, Chef Lauren begins by serving up an Asian inspired rice dish complete with crunchy water chestnuts. She starts off cooking rice in chicken broth, a great way to infuse the grain with a subtle savoury flavour. Sautéing celery, garlic, and onion in sesame oil adds a flavour kick. Throw in some ginger, veggies, and water chestnuts and enjoy the sound of the sizzle. Next up, Lauren puts a peppery twist on a classic recipe, linguine with watercress pesto. Then it’s time for the grand finale, Chef Lauren uses both...

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Tea and turkey are an unlikely combo for a meal, but Chef Robert Jewell is a creative force in the kitchen. First, he gives earl grey and lavender tea a sweet treatment by making a rich semifreddo. Robert creates a silky tea infused syrup, which he drizzles over a luxurious custard and tops with whipped cream. Robert punches up the colour by adding tart poached raspberries and vibrant violet lavender petals. Now, it's time for a real show stopper - saffron turkey kebabs with pomegranate rice. This is not your average turkey dinner. First, Robert marinates the turkey pieces in lime, yogourt and garlic. After infusing basmati rice with aromatic saffron and bay leaves, Robert tosses the rice...

programme.title: Pressure's On
programme.desc: Host Vanessa Gianfrancesco cooks her way from Monday to Friday with four delicious dishes, including a Roast Beef feast and velvety Earl Grey Pudding.

programme.title: Pressure's On
programme.desc: Home cook Vanessa Gianfrancesco uses her multi-cooker to whip up four comforting weeknight meals that are fast and easy.

programme.title: Holiday Eatz
programme.desc: Boo! Did that scare you? If so, then you better steer clear of this super spooky Holiday Eatz Halloween episode with chef-host Kimberly Lallouz! But that would be too bad, because then you'd miss a menu featuring fun but grown-up Halloween eats like Jack O'Lantern Curry, served with Irish-inspired spiced Pumpkin Barmbrack bread. Next, you'd miss a ghostly surprise with her pan seared Black Cod buried in a pile of carrot-chip 'Autumn Leaves' and drizzled with mango sauce made with"... ghost peppers! Her 'Fet Ghede' (Haitian Day of the Dead) inspired beef rib follows"... with a rib bone connected to"... melting tender beef braised in Haiti's signature Epis spice and crunched-up with yummy...

programme.title: Pressure's On
programme.desc: Using a multi-cooker, charming host Vanessa Gianfrancesco cooks up a four dishes that are salty, sweet, and surprising.

programme.title: Bring On The Karbs
programme.desc: Chefs Erica and Josh Karbelnik go head-to-head to see who can come up with the spookiest Halloween meal! Josh makes pumpkin curry. crispy chicken feet. and calf liver. while Erica pumpkin shaped gnocchi. witch hat shaped pasta. and bruschetta with mushroom skulls!

programme.title: Global Street Eats
programme.desc: Chef Dev is joined by his mom. who helps prepare some of their favorite dishes from a trip they took together through Asia. including Gado Gado Salad from Indonesia. Peanut Pancakes from Malaysia. and Pad Thai from Thailand.

programme.title: Global Street Eats
programme.desc: Chef Dev is joined by his mom. who helps prepare some of their favorite dishes from their travels together around Asia. including Yakisoba Noodles from Japan. Hainanese Chicken Rice from Singapore. and massive Mandu Dumplings from South Korea.

programme.title: Spencer's Big 30
programme.desc: Kids don't always love fish - host Spencer Watts shares some simple, inexpensive, and tasty recipes that will change your kids' opinion of fish night.

programme.title: Spencer's Big 30
programme.desc: Host Spencer Watts cooks up a Southern-style feast for the whole family including Crunchy Coleslaw and Oven Barbeque Chicken all in under 30 minutes.

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: In this episode of Up the Dish, host Micah Trainor takes a stab at Cassoulet with buttery white beans, duck leg confit, and flavourful French sausage - and the result is mouth-wateringly good! The pressure's on, but Tiera Singh doesn't let up with her Chinese Long Bean Stir Fry. Succulent sausage, delicious duck breast, and flavorful vegetables come together for a truly sumptuous dish! For her vegetarian variant, Missy Hui must move things up a notch, but how? Agedashi Tofu! Breaded crispy semi-firm tofu is doused in a dashi, gochujang, and mirin mixture for the ultimate umami mouthful. Poppy Sandler goes above and beyond with her Chocolate-crusted Elk Loin, seared and drizzled with a...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Who said dessert couldn't come before dinner? In this episode of Up the Dish, host Missy Hui serves up a hedonistically hard-to-beat Carrot Cake, made extra-moist with applesauce and tons of cream cheese icing. Micah Trainor ditches dessert and heads for the healthy option - a Cider Poached Chicken Waldorf Salad full of pecans and cinnamon for that classic cake flavour. Poppy Sandler innovates with Indian inspiration - carrot cake becomes Carrot Rostis, thin pancakes dished out with perfectly poached eggs and a homemade savoury raisin jam. Tiera Singh returns to the Rock and makes Jerk Crab Salad Mango Rolls. Jazzing up the crab meat with a blend of Jamaican jerk and autumn spices, she...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: First up on this episode of Up the Dish is Poppy Sandler's Borscht straight from the Eastern Bloc! A mix of roasted and simmered beets adds complexity to the creamy soup - and don't forget that vivid burgundy hue. Tiera Singh swaps soup for a sandwich with her Beet-Stained Trout Gravlax, pairing the eye-catching seafood with zesty lemon-dill cream cheese and rye pumpernickel bread. Next, Micah Trainor mixes up a vegetarian Roasted Beet Salad paired with crackly Seed Brittle and a simple sweet dressing; it's a crunchy, earthy delight! Missy Hui's three-layer Red Beet Velvet Cake is a true triple threat. Red beet puree gives this cake its vermillion colour - and pairing it with tangy goat...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Micah Trainor boils it down for this episode of Up the Dish! Her Cajun Seafood Boil simmers with luscious lobster, smoky andouille, and supERS-sized crab; a perfect blend of zesty, spicy, and succulent. It's a hard act to follow, but Missy Hui is up for it. Her Corned Beef Boiled Dinner is a call back to the Emerald Isle - home-cured pickled beef bubbles away with veggies in a beefy broth. Poppy Sandler's vegetarian addition? Moroccan Vegetable Stew! A North African-style spice blend heats this dish up, while chickpeas and other veggies soak up the flavour. Tiera Singh takes a spicy approach with her one-pot delight - Guyanese Pepperpot. Loaded with scotch-bonnet peppers, osso bucco, and...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: The ultimate childhood comfort food, Grilled Cheese and Tomato Soup! Missy Hui takes this dish up with a basil- infused tomato soup that's ubERS-creamy and fresh! Don't forget the grilled cheese - gooey Havarti, provolone, and cheddar ooze out of this sandwich for an ultra-indulgent dish. Tiera Singh's twist on toast and tomatoes? Panzanella Salad! Ripe, seasonal tomatoes are tossed with a tangy capERS-vinegar dressing that is soaked up by crunchy croutons. Going higher? Micah Trainor's Seared Halloumi and Glazed Fruit grills the cheese - no bread needed! Seared halloumi is topped with bourbon-glazed fruit for a savoury-sweet vegetarian dish. Poppy Sandler's Lobster Roll with Sweet Corn...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Up the Dish host Micah Trainor tries her hand at an Italian original - Veal Piccata! Lemony, buttery, capERS-y veal melts in the mouth after being pounded supERS-thin and seared to perfection. Poppy Sandler's sideways switch-up is a Caper Almond Crusted Halibut, sizzled and baked until gorgeously golden-brown and flaky, then garnished with chives and pea shoots. Next, Missy Hui goes Greek with her vegetarian Avgolemono, a silky-smooth citrusy soup starring lemon and egg, garnished with orzo and shimeji mushrooms. Tiera Singh ties it all together with her Sumac Veal Sweetbreads with a rough chopped caperberry-olive tapenade - browned veal sweetbreads are sprinkled with tart sumac and laid...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: How many ways can salmon be prepared? Up the Dish is on a mission to find out! Tiera Singh's Salmon Salad NiÃ§oise is a staple of the French Riviera with shallot, eggs, and haricot verts, but she swaps out the tuna for luxuriant olive oil poached salmon - it may not be traditional but it sure tastes good! Poppy Sandler smokes the competition with a buttery Smoked Salmon Omelette, garnished with fresh chives and earthy goat cheese. Next, Micah Trainor skips the salmon but keeps the veggies for her steamed Tofu Nori Dim Sum Dumplings, with tart gingERS-pickled shallots and tons of green goodness. Missy Hui has the big finish; her Salmon with Béarnaise is cooked sous vide for a precisely...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Onions, cheese, bread, soup, four elements that live in harmony, especially in this episode of Up the Dish! Poppy Sandler starts off in Paris - classic French Onion Soup with sweet, caramelized onions and melty Comte cheese, with perfect rounds of toasted baguette. Poppy passes it over to Micah Trainor, who doesn't miss a beat; her Tenderloin Roast with Sherry Braised Shallots is sweet, savoury, and bursting with flavour. Tiera Singh takes a chive-y dive into the vegetarian side with her Chive Pesto Pasta - don't worry, the pesto is totally customizable! Missy Hui has the showstopper, Scallion Ash Carrots and Parsnips, and it's a five-star treatment that takes the simple to spectacular!...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Host Tiera Singh goes on a South American tour with Peruvian Ceviche. Marinated citrusy seabass and shrimp swim in a sea of sweet potatoes and creamy avocado - it's hard to beat! But Poppy Sandler takes a shot, and lands on Grilled Shrimp with a smoky charred Corn and Avocado salad, topped with garlic and lemon grilled jumbo shrimp. Next, Missy Hui indulges her sweet tooth with Vegan Key Lime Tarts. Her trick? Using avocado for extra cream and extra green. Branzino with Shishito and Mango is how Micah Trainor scales it up - her whole-fish-dish is pan-roasted and spiced with chaat masala, topped with mangoes and blistered shishito peppers for a five-star feast!

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: In this episode of Up the Dish, steal away to Spain for a summer vacation as host Tiera Singh takes a swing at Paella, complete with sunny saffron, saucy sofrito, and super crunchy soccarat. Next, Missy Hui takes a break for brunch with Chorizo Eggs Benedict - the Saffron Hollandaise is good as gold and twice as bright! Poppy Sandler follows with her Fritto Misto and Sofrito, a delicate and fresh veggie fry-up that soaks up a tomato-spiked sofrito dipping sauce. Micah Trainor finishes up with restaurant-ready Razor Clams steamed in sparkling Spanish wine, served alongside nutty Iberico Ham and sweet Manchego cheese.

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Up the Dish goes French cuisine with Poppy Sandler's classic Coq au Vin! Slow-cooked chicken in a luscious red wine sauce with pearl onions and mushrooms on the side? Yes please! Tiera Singh sticks with the tricolour theme and makes a Salad Lyonnaise - crispy bacon, poached eggs, and homemade croutons, with a red wine-bacon vinaigrette that steals the show. Missy Hui stays on the continent but skips la Republique; her Vincotto Mushrooms with Lentils uses an Italian wine to sauce up meaty oyster mushrooms and aromatic vegetables for a vegetarian twist. But Micah Trainor takes us right back to France - her Rabbit Rillettes with Champagne Gelee is white tablecloth worthy, with rabbit confit...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Get ready for a not-so-raw deal in this episode of Up the Dish! Host Poppy Sandler sets things in motion and slices up a simple, elegant Sashimi with tangy Ponzu and tart Wasabi Mayo on the side. Missy Hui gets carnivorous with Lamb Carpaccio and Dukkah - delicate raw lamb and a Middle Eastern-style dip served with some delicious pita! But wait, what's a vegetarian to do with all this meat? Tiera Singh's got the answer - island-style Poke Bowls, with fruit instead of fish. Refreshing watermelon is marinated in a savoury, soy-based sauce and served with rice. For the finale, Micah Trainor Up('s) the Dish with her Scallop Tartare and Beet Chips, combining raw scallops with ultra-decadent...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Take a trip around the world in this episode of Up the Dish! Host Missy Hui hits the Great Wall running - her Chinese Fried Rice recipe is a classic complete with crispy bacon, crunchy onions and savoury scallions. Then, Poppy Sandler sets off for the Land of the Rising Sun with Crispy Sushi Rice and Spicy Tuna; sriracha mayo seasons the sushi-grade tuna and sticky short-grain rice cakes are fried (fried rice anyone?) to a beautiful golden-brown. Micah Trainor's Gorgonzola-Chive Arancini puts a Sicilian spin on frying rice - panko-crusted arborio is creamy and flavourful with blue cheese and chives for this ultra-indulgent Italian redux. Rice Papad with Turkey Tikka Masala is Tiera...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Host Tiera Singh gets the show on the road with her Italian- inspired Fennel Orange Salad. Seared sushi-grade tuna rests on top of a crunchy, zesty, tangy fennel and orange salad with a honey-vinegar dressing to sweeten it up! Micah Trainor's revamp? Five Spice Duck a L'Orange with a sugary caramelized orange sauce and duck fat fried potatoes - is it French? Chinese? Who knows, but it's delicious! Next, Poppy Sandler pulls off a vegetarian variation, with a Roasted Veggie Bouillabaisse, complete with musky morels, umami-packed kombu, and tender asparagus. Missy Hui finishes up with her Orange Licorice Panna Cotta - aromatic orange blossom honey and licorice-like fennel pollen make the...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: This episode of Up the Dish brings a taste of Thailand to the screen as host Missy Hui makes everyone's favourite: Pad Thai. Succulent chicken thigh and semi-firm tofu are stir-fried with veggies and traditional Thai ingredients - tamarind, palm sugar, lime, sriracha, and fish sauce. Micah Trainor's up next - her Tequila-Lime Glazed Chicken Thighs come with veggie 'noodles' and are sweetened and spiced with agave syrup and chipotle peppers for a meal that feels like Mexico! Then Tiera Singh slips off to Seoul with her Korean BBQ Tofu - peanut buttery and spiked with homemade Korean BBQ sauce, the meaty tofu is wrapped up in lettuce and topped with tons of yummy veggies. Poppy Sandler ends...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Host Micah Trainor's Hawaiian Pizza is the perfect salty- sweet piece of pie, with grilled pineapple and supERS-easy homemade pizza dough. That's dinner done, so Missy Hui handles dessert, with a Pineapple Upside-Down Cake covered in a homemade sea salt caramel. Next, colour is the core of Tiera Singh's vegan Rainbow Salad Rolls - juicy mango, creamy avocado, and crisp bibb lettuce are wrapped in rice paper for a vibrant veggie-filled dish. Then it's Poppy Sandler's turn to really Up the Dish... her response? Salty Miso and sweet Honey meet for her Black Cod with Sesame-Garlic Veggies! The marinated fish is seared and served over savoury veggies roasted in garlic- infused sesame oil.

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: In this episode of Up the Dish, host Micah Trainor takes a stab at Cassoulet with buttery white beans, duck leg confit, and flavourful French sausage - and the result is mouth-wateringly good! The pressure's on, but Tiera Singh doesn't let up with her Chinese Long Bean Stir Fry. Succulent sausage, delicious duck breast, and flavorful vegetables come together for a truly sumptuous dish! For her vegetarian variant, Missy Hui must move things up a notch, but how? Agedashi Tofu! Breaded crispy semi-firm tofu is doused in a dashi, gochujang, and mirin mixture for the ultimate umami mouthful. Poppy Sandler goes above and beyond with her Chocolate-crusted Elk Loin, seared and drizzled with a...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Who said dessert couldn't come before dinner? In this episode of Up the Dish, host Missy Hui serves up a hedonistically hard-to-beat Carrot Cake, made extra-moist with applesauce and tons of cream cheese icing. Micah Trainor ditches dessert and heads for the healthy option - a Cider Poached Chicken Waldorf Salad full of pecans and cinnamon for that classic cake flavour. Poppy Sandler innovates with Indian inspiration - carrot cake becomes Carrot Rostis, thin pancakes dished out with perfectly poached eggs and a homemade savoury raisin jam. Tiera Singh returns to the Rock and makes Jerk Crab Salad Mango Rolls. Jazzing up the crab meat with a blend of Jamaican jerk and autumn spices, she...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: First up on this episode of Up the Dish is Poppy Sandler's Borscht straight from the Eastern Bloc! A mix of roasted and simmered beets adds complexity to the creamy soup - and don't forget that vivid burgundy hue. Tiera Singh swaps soup for a sandwich with her Beet-Stained Trout Gravlax, pairing the eye-catching seafood with zesty lemon-dill cream cheese and rye pumpernickel bread. Next, Micah Trainor mixes up a vegetarian Roasted Beet Salad paired with crackly Seed Brittle and a simple sweet dressing; it's a crunchy, earthy delight! Missy Hui's three-layer Red Beet Velvet Cake is a true triple threat. Red beet puree gives this cake its vermillion colour - and pairing it with tangy goat...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Micah Trainor boils it down for this episode of Up the Dish! Her Cajun Seafood Boil simmers with luscious lobster, smoky andouille, and supERS-sized crab; a perfect blend of zesty, spicy, and succulent. It's a hard act to follow, but Missy Hui is up for it. Her Corned Beef Boiled Dinner is a call back to the Emerald Isle - home-cured pickled beef bubbles away with veggies in a beefy broth. Poppy Sandler's vegetarian addition? Moroccan Vegetable Stew! A North African-style spice blend heats this dish up, while chickpeas and other veggies soak up the flavour. Tiera Singh takes a spicy approach with her one-pot delight - Guyanese Pepperpot. Loaded with scotch-bonnet peppers, osso bucco, and...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: The ultimate childhood comfort food, Grilled Cheese and Tomato Soup! Missy Hui takes this dish up with a basil- infused tomato soup that's ubERS-creamy and fresh! Don't forget the grilled cheese - gooey Havarti, provolone, and cheddar ooze out of this sandwich for an ultra-indulgent dish. Tiera Singh's twist on toast and tomatoes? Panzanella Salad! Ripe, seasonal tomatoes are tossed with a tangy capERS-vinegar dressing that is soaked up by crunchy croutons. Going higher? Micah Trainor's Seared Halloumi and Glazed Fruit grills the cheese - no bread needed! Seared halloumi is topped with bourbon-glazed fruit for a savoury-sweet vegetarian dish. Poppy Sandler's Lobster Roll with Sweet Corn...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Up the Dish host Micah Trainor tries her hand at an Italian original - Veal Piccata! Lemony, buttery, capERS-y veal melts in the mouth after being pounded supERS-thin and seared to perfection. Poppy Sandler's sideways switch-up is a Caper Almond Crusted Halibut, sizzled and baked until gorgeously golden-brown and flaky, then garnished with chives and pea shoots. Next, Missy Hui goes Greek with her vegetarian Avgolemono, a silky-smooth citrusy soup starring lemon and egg, garnished with orzo and shimeji mushrooms. Tiera Singh ties it all together with her Sumac Veal Sweetbreads with a rough chopped caperberry-olive tapenade - browned veal sweetbreads are sprinkled with tart sumac and laid...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: How many ways can salmon be prepared? Up the Dish is on a mission to find out! Tiera Singh's Salmon Salad NiÃ§oise is a staple of the French Riviera with shallot, eggs, and haricot verts, but she swaps out the tuna for luxuriant olive oil poached salmon - it may not be traditional but it sure tastes good! Poppy Sandler smokes the competition with a buttery Smoked Salmon Omelette, garnished with fresh chives and earthy goat cheese. Next, Micah Trainor skips the salmon but keeps the veggies for her steamed Tofu Nori Dim Sum Dumplings, with tart gingERS-pickled shallots and tons of green goodness. Missy Hui has the big finish; her Salmon with Béarnaise is cooked sous vide for a precisely...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Onions, cheese, bread, soup, four elements that live in harmony, especially in this episode of Up the Dish! Poppy Sandler starts off in Paris - classic French Onion Soup with sweet, caramelized onions and melty Comte cheese, with perfect rounds of toasted baguette. Poppy passes it over to Micah Trainor, who doesn't miss a beat; her Tenderloin Roast with Sherry Braised Shallots is sweet, savoury, and bursting with flavour. Tiera Singh takes a chive-y dive into the vegetarian side with her Chive Pesto Pasta - don't worry, the pesto is totally customizable! Missy Hui has the showstopper, Scallion Ash Carrots and Parsnips, and it's a five-star treatment that takes the simple to spectacular!...

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: Host Tiera Singh goes on a South American tour with Peruvian Ceviche. Marinated citrusy seabass and shrimp swim in a sea of sweet potatoes and creamy avocado - it's hard to beat! But Poppy Sandler takes a shot, and lands on Grilled Shrimp with a smoky charred Corn and Avocado salad, topped with garlic and lemon grilled jumbo shrimp. Next, Missy Hui indulges her sweet tooth with Vegan Key Lime Tarts. Her trick? Using avocado for extra cream and extra green. Branzino with Shishito and Mango is how Micah Trainor scales it up - her whole-fish-dish is pan-roasted and spiced with chaat masala, topped with mangoes and blistered shishito peppers for a five-star feast!

programme.title: Bring on the Karbs
programme.desc: Chefs Erica and Josh Karbelnik put their heads together to design a three-course menu, where each course must be based around either land, sea, or air! You have to “sea” it to believe it!

programme.title: Bring on the Karbs
programme.desc: Chefs Erica and Josh Karbelnik go head-to-head to see who can come up with the more tantalizing dish! The catch? Each of their plates must prominently feature both scallops and pork tenderloin!

programme.title: Bring on the Karbs

Rohan Patoley takes the tour of the most famous brewery at the town that has been practicing the art of brewing beer over 700 years.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.desc: Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty try bungee jumping at the staggeringly high Kobae Bridge. Following this, they explore some rejuvenating nature trails at Takachiho, stumble upon a shrine in a park, and learn the story behind it in a riveting manner, later that day.

programme.title: The Moroccon Chronicles

programme.title: Burn Appetit
programme.desc: Jolly leaves behind the Styrian region and heads to the Alps, on his adventure across Austria, where gastronomy meets adrenalin.

programme.title: Xplore Czech Republic
programme.desc: Legend has it that Karlovy Vary was founded by the Czech king and Roman emperor Charles IV, who discovered a unique spring here while hunting deer one evening. This historic spa town in Czech Republic is known for the healing power of its thermal springs. Rohan explores a few of them including the Freedom and Rusalka Springs and understands their significance to the town.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s adventures in Perth kick off with him immersing himself in the historic grandeur of the Scone Castle, where a mysterious stone tells tales of Scottish monarchs. But the real thunder of the Highlands awaits at the Braemar Games gathering, where tartan meets brawn, and Robbie learns that embracing his Scottish side involves more than just kilts and castles.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Novi Sad, the financial and industrial hub of Serbia.Starting with canoeing on Danube and later exploring the city and its landmarks.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Santa Village at Rovaniemi, where she reads some of the letters that children from around the world write to him.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Benafsha embarks on a whirlwind adventure in Ahmedabad. With just 48 hours in the city, she is determined to make the most of it, but how?

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: From lazing in hammocks by the beach to sipping drinks on a private yacht, Kim realizes that Maldives is the perfect destination to unwind in style.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying dishes like Stroopwafel and Palat Stoofvlees to visiting the Erasmus bridge, cube houses and wall painting on the streets, Alex explores Rotterdam.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous 'granite city' of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Explore Majdanpek with our host as the city brings the viewers closer to the treasures strewn across the Serbian countryside.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Levi is Finland's largest and fastest-growing ski destination. Emeline is here, to find out the exciting activities that Levi offers, in summer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: With snow-capped peaks rising over primeval forests and traditional villages, Paro is like an Oriental Switzerland. On a visit to Paro, Radhika explores famous monasteries such as the Rinpung Dzong and Takstang Monastery, and learns the history and legends associated with them. Along the way, she finds out the secrets to the quintessential Bhutanese peace and contentment.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: An invigorating spa treatment, a cooking lesson, a snorkeling session – Kim has experiences in the Maldives that leave her completely rejuvenated.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying Orange zest beer and traditional Dutch dishes to exploring St.Martin's Cathedral, Dom Tower and enjoying go karting and stand up paddle boat ride, watch Alex enjoy his trip in Utrecht.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: In the enchanting landscapes of Inverness, Robbie’s journey takes a whimsical turn: from eccentric to downright magical.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Nis,one of the oldest cities in Europe.She visits a concentration camp and later paraglides to end by watching a musical performance.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline goes to Ruka-Kuusamo, where she tries river rafting. She also meets a reindeer herder,who tells her about the unique ways of herding reindeer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Actress and travel enthusiast, Radhika Bangia explores the enigma that is Bhutan, when she visits Thimpu, the capital city with no traffic lights and no skyscrapers invading the skyline. Here, she checks out significant sights such as the Tibetan-style National Memorial Chorten, the National Library and the Folk Heritage Museum in order to understand more about the beliefs, history, architecture and cuisine of Bhutan.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.desc: Explore the ancient heritage sites of Abu Simbel, the Philae complex of Nubia and the Hatshepsut Temple to unravel the mystical stories behind the ancient temples of Egypt.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: Alex tries traditional Dutch food in Leiden, learns about Dutch history at Prinsenhof Museum, visits a Gothic church, a local cheese market and Delftware factory at Gouda.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: The grand finale of Robbie’s wild homecoming unfolds amidst the rugged beauty of the Isle of Skye.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Continue exploring Serbia with Heather as she visits the Manasija monastery, Resavska caves, ending with a joyride onboard Eight of Sargan rail line.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.desc: Krisann and Nathan’s vacation in Mauritius begins in Le Morne, where an unexpected adventure awaits the latter.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Known as Druk Yul or the “Land of the Thunder Dragon”, Bhutan is the country of mountains, monasteries and mystery. Radhika Bangia finds this to be true when she visits Punakha, the former capital of Bhutan, where she marvels at the architecture of Punakha Dzong and gets to know the story behind the two rivers, Mo Chhu and Po Chhu. She also explores the sacred temples and Mebar Tsho lake of Bumthang, the religious heart of Bhutan, and gets to know the local legends.

programme.title: World Spas
programme.desc: Jamie Srubis tries out spa treatments, which are inspired by the Dead Sea and the desert surroundings at Hotel Kempinski Ishtar in Jordan.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: After Burj Khalifa, Alex has a traditional Emirati platter, visits the gold market and skiing rink, and goes for a camel safari and camping.

programme.title: City break
programme.desc: Nestled in the mighty Alps, tour the Austrian city of Innsbruck with Sabrina and explore a town that’s alpine-urban yet traditional in nature.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: In her final leg of journey, Heather visits the Uvac canyon, tries locally prepared pie, ending with Kopaonik National Park and Jelovarnik waterfalls.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.desc: On an island-hopping adventure in Mauritius, Krisann and Nathan find out that time works differently on these islands.

programme.title: XP Guide
programme.desc: A homely place where the aroma of freshly baked bread greets you as people smoothly glide along on their bicycles. Welcome to Copenhagen.

programme.title: Unwind
programme.desc: Indeya explores the Cinnamon plantations, tries a local dish and witnesses a traditional dance performance.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: Alex has varied experiences in Dubai like trying Lebanese cheese bread, visiting a coffee museum, going to IMG Worlds of Adventure and more.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: In Amsterdam, Alex tries Bitterballen, cannabis cake and visits Heineken Experience brewery. He explores Zaanse Schans village with windmills and Coster Diamonds, the oldest diamond polishing factory.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s journey to reconnect with his Scottish roots begins in Edinburgh, the stunning capital city perched on extinct volcanoes. Navigating the twists of the Royal Mile, strutting around the majestic Edinburgh castle and learning to sip scotch like a true Scotsman, he feels a tad closer to his heritage. The real fun kicks in, however, when he stumbles onto a rather flamboyant way to unleash his inner Highlander.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Like Rome, Plovdiv straddles seven hills; but as Europe’s oldest continuously inhabited city, it’s far more ancient. As Catriona takes a tour of the city to see its iconic attractions such as a Roman Amphitheatre, which was once the setting for gladiator fights, and the striking Baroque Saints Constantine and Helena Church, she begins to see how seamlessly modern life blends with the age-old ruins. Along the way, she realizes why Plovdiv is called the ‘Eternal City’ of Bulgaria.

But the real thunder of the Highlands awaits at the Braemar Games gathering, where tartan meets brawn, and Robbie learns that embracing his Scottish side involves more than just kilts and castles.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Novi Sad, the financial and industrial hub of Serbia.Starting with canoeing on Danube and later exploring the city and its landmarks.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Santa Village at Rovaniemi, where she reads some of the letters that children from around the world write to him.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Benafsha embarks on a whirlwind adventure in Ahmedabad. With just 48 hours in the city, she is determined to make the most of it, but how?

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: From lazing in hammocks by the beach to sipping drinks on a private yacht, Kim realizes that Maldives is the perfect destination to unwind in style.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying dishes like Stroopwafel and Palat Stoofvlees to visiting the Erasmus bridge, cube houses and wall painting on the streets, Alex explores Rotterdam.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous 'granite city' of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Explore Majdanpek with our host as the city brings the viewers closer to the treasures strewn across the Serbian countryside.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Levi is Finland's largest and fastest-growing ski destination. Emeline is here, to find out the exciting activities that Levi offers, in summer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: With snow-capped peaks rising over primeval forests and traditional villages, Paro is like an Oriental Switzerland. On a visit to Paro, Radhika explores famous monasteries such as the Rinpung Dzong and Takstang Monastery, and learns the history and legends associated with them. Along the way, she finds out the secrets to the quintessential Bhutanese peace and contentment.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: An invigorating spa treatment, a cooking lesson, a snorkeling session – Kim has experiences in the Maldives that leave her completely rejuvenated.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying Orange zest beer and traditional Dutch dishes to exploring St.Martin's Cathedral, Dom Tower and enjoying go karting and stand up paddle boat ride, watch Alex enjoy his trip in Utrecht.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: In the enchanting landscapes of Inverness, Robbie’s journey takes a whimsical turn: from eccentric to downright magical.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Nis,one of the oldest cities in Europe.She visits a concentration camp and later paraglides to end by watching a musical performance.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline goes to Ruka-Kuusamo, where she tries river rafting. She also meets a reindeer herder,who tells her about the unique ways of herding reindeer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Actress and travel enthusiast, Radhika Bangia explores the enigma that is Bhutan, when she visits Thimpu, the capital city with no traffic lights and no skyscrapers invading the skyline. Here, she checks out significant sights such as the Tibetan-style National Memorial Chorten, the National Library and the Folk Heritage Museum in order to understand more about the beliefs, history, architecture and cuisine of Bhutan.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.desc: Explore the ancient heritage sites of Abu Simbel, the Philae complex of Nubia and the Hatshepsut Temple to unravel the mystical stories behind the ancient temples of Egypt.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: Alex tries traditional Dutch food in Leiden, learns about Dutch history at Prinsenhof Museum, visits a Gothic church, a local cheese market and Delftware factory at Gouda.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: The grand finale of Robbie’s wild homecoming unfolds amidst the rugged beauty of the Isle of Skye.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Continue exploring Serbia with Heather as she visits the Manasija monastery, Resavska caves, ending with a joyride onboard Eight of Sargan rail line.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.desc: Krisann and Nathan’s vacation in Mauritius begins in Le Morne, where an unexpected adventure awaits the latter.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Known as Druk Yul or the “Land of the Thunder Dragon”, Bhutan is the country of mountains, monasteries and mystery. Radhika Bangia finds this to be true when she visits Punakha, the former capital of Bhutan, where she marvels at the architecture of Punakha Dzong and gets to know the story behind the two rivers, Mo Chhu and Po Chhu. She also explores the sacred temples and Mebar Tsho lake of Bumthang, the religious heart of Bhutan, and gets to know the local legends.

programme.title: World Spas
programme.desc: Jamie Srubis tries out spa treatments, which are inspired by the Dead Sea and the desert surroundings at Hotel Kempinski Ishtar in Jordan.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: After Burj Khalifa, Alex has a traditional Emirati platter, visits the gold market and skiing rink, and goes for a camel safari and camping.

programme.title: City break
programme.desc: Nestled in the mighty Alps, tour the Austrian city of Innsbruck with Sabrina and explore a town that’s alpine-urban yet traditional in nature.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: In her final leg of journey, Heather visits the Uvac canyon, tries locally prepared pie, ending with Kopaonik National Park and Jelovarnik waterfalls.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.desc: On an island-hopping adventure in Mauritius, Krisann and Nathan find out that time works differently on these islands.

programme.title: XP Guide
programme.desc: A homely place where the aroma of freshly baked bread greets you as people smoothly glide along on their bicycles. Welcome to Copenhagen.

programme.title: Unwind
programme.desc: Indeya explores the Cinnamon plantations, tries a local dish and witnesses a traditional dance performance.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: Alex has varied experiences in Dubai like trying Lebanese cheese bread, visiting a coffee museum, going to IMG Worlds of Adventure and more.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita chef Cesare Casella nel suo ristorante nel Village "Maremma" per preparare alcune delle sue ricette preferite. Con Cesare Ornella visita upstate un allevamento di maiali e mucche Chianine. Cesare Casella oltre ad essere un bravissimo chef è anche uno stimatissimo insegnate, è infatti il Dean del programma di cucina italiana all' "International Culinary Center" a Soho ed Ornella è andata a trovarlo con le telecamere di Brindiamo!.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: La puntata di oggi è ricca di contenuti. Ornella Fado incontra Cristina Carrani, esperta in materia immobiliare che aiuterà Ornella a scoprire l'Isola di Capri. Dalla moda alla storia, al cibo e all'arte, Brindiamo! Edizione speciale Capri è l'episodio perfetto per festeggiare i 18 anni di Brindiamo! su NYC LIFE.

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, visita il ristorante stellato "Madonnina del Pescatore", a Senigallia. Insieme a chef Moreno Cedroni preparano delle ricette belle da vedere e deliziose da mangiare.In questa puntata Ornella è ospite all'inaugurazione della cantina di Domodimonti nelle Marche.(2010)

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, visita una pizzeria "Olio Pizza e Più" nel Village a Manhattan, dove incontra master pizzaiolo Giulio Adriani, campione mondiale di pizza margherita. Oltre a preparare favole pizze, Ornella incontra Edoardo Bennato all'istituto Italiano di Cultura di New York ed insieme cantano alcuni brani famosissimi. (2010)

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, visita uno dei ristoranti piu` longevi di Brooklyn,"Marco Polo" ma prima di entrare nella cucina per preparare alcune ricette del ristorante con l'excutive chef Bruno Miloni e chef Marco Chirico, Ornella visita i famoso mercato del pesce nel Bronx con Giuseppe Chirico (proprietario del ristorante) e suo figlio Marco. In questo epsiodio Ornella ha anche il piacere di intervistare il cantautore Ron, al secolo Rosallino Cellamare. (2011)

programme.title: Eccellenze Italiane con Piero Muscari intervista a Heinz Beck
programme.desc: Pietro Muscari intervista Lorenzo Suraci, Presidente di RTL 102.5. Lorenzo rivela come ha iniziato a lavorare con celebrità come Maurizio Costanzo e Bruno Vespa e quali sono i progetti futuri per la prima radio in Italia.

programme.title: Eccellenze Italiane con Piero Muscari intervista a Heinz Beck
programme.desc: Pietro Muscari intervista Enrico Vaime, autore e conduttore radio e TV. Con Enrico si parla di radio, tv, libri, ma anche di amore e dispiaceri che hanno formato la sua carriera.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita cinque amici ristoratori durante le feste Natalizie, prima tappa" Angelina's" a Staten Island, poi e` la volta di "Marco Polo" e "Luzzo" a Brooklyn. A Manhattan nell'Upper East side, Ornella visita "83 e mezza". Ultima tappa per ujn buon gelato,"Dolce Gelateria" nel Village. (2013)

programme.title: Il CIRCOLO DEL BUONGUSTAI Con Fabio Campoli
programme.desc: Benvenuti a questo nuovo episodio del Circolo dei Buongustai! Cosa bolle in pentola? Oggi il nostro chef Fabio Campoli ci delizierà con tre ricette speciali: cono di stesa, venere nera, e babà al bergamotto. Buona visione a tutti!

programme.title: Il CIRCOLO DEL BUONGUSTAI Con Fabio Campoli
programme.desc: Benvenuti a questo nuovo episodio del Circolo dei Buongustai! Cosa bolle in pentola? Oggi il nostro chef Fabio Campoli ci delizierà con tre ricette speciali: portafoglio di squacquerone, ciliegie e mortadella, riso rosso integrale con pollo e peperoni, diplomatico alle rose. Buona visione a tutti!

programme.title: Il CIRCOLO DEL BUONGUSTAI Con Fabio Campoli
programme.desc: Benvenuti a questo nuovo episodio del Circolo dei Buongustai! Cosa bolle in pentola? Oggi il nostro chef Fabio Campoli ci delizierà con tre ricette speciali: rotolo di riso, prosciutto e melone, risotto alla rucola con kiwi e vongole, e budino di riso. Buona visione a tutti!

programme.title: Change your Destiny
programme.desc: Terza ed ultima puntata della serie. Antonio Fini ed i suoi giudici sono pronti: chi sceglieranno per volare a NEW YORK per il prestigioso festival della danza? Ancora una volta i ragazzi devono convincere l'importante giuria con il loro pezzo migliore, la contemporary battle e la lezione di danza "tecnica Parson" con la maestra Abby Silva.

programme.title: Change your Destiny
programme.desc: Nella prima puntata Antonio Fini ed i suoi giudici incontrano il primo gruppo di ballerini.Per essere selezionati per il prestigioso festival di danza in NEW YORK devono affrontare 3 sfide: presentare il loro pezzo migliore, la contemporary battle e la lezione di danza "tecnica Graham" con il maestro Antonio Fini.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova nel laboratorio di Urbani Truffle a New York ed invita i suoi amici chef per preparare insieme delle ricette da gustare durante le festività natalizie. In questa puntata Chef Pino Coladonato, Chef Marcello Russodivito e la giovane pizzaiola Giorgia Caporuscio. In questa edizione di Brindiamo! in my Kitchen ospite speciale la soprano Cristina Fontanelli e John La Barbera, oltre a vari ospiti del mondo dello spettacolo, e della moda. (2016)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova nel laboratorio di Urbani Truffle a New York per la serconda parte di Brindiamo! in my kitchen. I suoi amici chef in questa puntata son lo chef Raffaele Ronca, lo Chef Marco Chirico e il giovane pizzaiolo Ettore Toches. In questa edizione di Brindiamo! in my Kitchen la musica è dal vivo con la soprano Cristina Fontanelli ed il compositore Jhon La Barbera, tra gli ospiti di questa puntata il Fashion designer Domenico Vacca. (2016)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita cinque amici ristoratori durante le feste Natalizie, prima tappa" Angelina's" a Staten Island, poi e` la volta di "Marco Polo" e "Luzzo" a Brooklyn. A Manhattan nell'Upper East side, Ornella visita "83 e mezza". Ultima tappa per ujn buon gelato,"Dolce Gelateria" nel Village. (2013)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado continua il suo giro per incontrare il suoi amici ristoratori durante le festività di capodanno. Visitando a midtown Chef Pino alla "La Masseria", chef Stefano e Franco a " Viceversa", a "PizzArte" incontra il pizzaiolo Roberto ed il proprietario Dario, a Queens visita "Ornella Trattoria" dove incontra Vincenzo e "Trattoria l'Incontro"dove incontra lo chef e proprietario Rocco. (2013/2014)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, si trova a Milano e visita uno storico ristorante stellato, "Aimo e Nadia", dove incontra ed intervista Stefania Moroni figlia della signora Nadia ed il signor Aimo. Nella bellissima cucina Ornella incontra due bravissimi chef come Fabio Pisani e Alessandro Negrini. Insieme preparano alcuni piatti classici del menù del ristorante di Aimo e Nadia.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Nel 2015 Ornella Fado ha celebrato 10 anni di produzione televisiva e di messa in onda su NYC LIFE, il canale pubblico di New York. Questa puntata raccoglie alcuni dei momenti più belli del programma televisivo Brindiamo!

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Continua il viaggio dei 10 anni di Brindiamo! nella seconda parte Ornella viene presentata dal famoso conduttore televisio della WB 11, Howard Thompson grande fan di Brindiamo! Nella prima parte della puntata, Ornella visita il ristorante "Il Baluardo" nella regione Piemonte dove incontra lo chef Marc Lanteri. A Central Park, Ornella intervista la bellissima Barbara D'Urso e rivivono le emozioni del party " La dolce Vita" dove Barbara era l'ospite d'onore con Lee Curreri.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova a Flushing Bay, a New York City nel quartiere del Queens. Puntata dedicata all'imprenditore italo americano Mike Rienzi, che da più di 50 anni produce per gli americani originali prodotti dell'Italia del sud, con veri ingredienti italiani. Mr. Rienzi racconta ad Ornella la sua bellissima storia, il vero sogno americano. All'interno di uno yacht Ornella incontra Savino Maffei, proprietario del rinomato pastificio Maffei, e due chef italiani ospiti di Mr.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova a Rye, New York, e incontra chef Rafele Ronca, proprietario del ristorante "Rafele Rye". La giusta occasione per preparare un menù completo tipico del centro e sud Italia. Ornella prosegue la sua visita intervistando chef Ronca, e l'imprenditrice e filantropa americana Annie Mara, nonchè proprietaria dei New York Giants, squadra della N.F.L. (2020)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado è stata invitata a Staten Island al ristorante "Angelina's" in occasione del fidanzamento in puro stile siciliano di Cristina Malerba. Con Vincent Malerba colgono l'occasione per visionare insieme i preparativi dall'atmosfera siciliana. In cucina con chef Vincent, Ornella prepara alcuni piatti tipici siciliani che verranno poi serviti durante la serata. Incontra poi Angelina Malerba proprietaria del ristorante, e ripercorrono insieme la loro amicizia e carriera.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado nel 2020 festeggia i primi 15 anni di broadcasting su NYC life e Brindiamo! ufficialmente diventa il programma di cucina più longevo del canale. In questa puntata vi presentiamo alcuni dei momenti più belli di questi ultimi anni di produzione alla scoperta della ristorazione italiana ospite della puntata Edoardo Bennato in New York. (2020)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado continua il viaggio dei 15 anni di Brindiamo! con una raccolta di ricette, interviste e storie degli ultimi anni del programma televisivo Brindiamo! opsite di questa puntata Ron a New York. (2020)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado presenta la terza parte del quindicesimo anniversario di Brindiamo! con ricette, interviste e storie, ospite della puntata Raf in Florida. (2020)

A "Cafe` Milano" Ornella incontra Franco Nushese, che racconta il suo sogno americano. Arrivato da Minori, Franco Nuschese, conquista l' America con l'alta ristorazione e il suo charm Italiano.

Ornella visita anche la scuola di restauro e parla con la responsabile della scuola Dr.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita Washington DC e va a scoprire un ristorante proprio a due passi dalla Casa Bianca, il ristorante si chiama "Luigino", il proprietario e chef è Carmine Marzano. Chef Marzano prepara delle ricette tipiche piemontesi. Ospite della trasmissione la bellissima Adrianna Sgarlata Miss Virginia 2006. (2006)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: La puntata di oggi è ricca di contenuti. Ornella Fado incontra Cristina Carrani, esperta in materia immobiliare che aiuterà Ornella a scoprire l'Isola di Capri. Dalla moda alla storia, al cibo e all'arte, Brindiamo! Edizione speciale Capri è l'episodio perfetto per festeggiare i 18 anni di Brindiamo! su NYC LIFE.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova a Flushing Bay, a New York City nel quartiere del Queens. Puntata dedicata all'imprenditore italo americano Mike Rienzi, che da più di 50 anni produce per gli americani originali prodotti dell'Italia del sud, con veri ingredienti italiani. Mr. Rienzi racconta ad Ornella la sua bellissima storia, il vero sogno americano. All'interno di uno yacht Ornella incontra Savino Maffei, proprietario del rinomato pastificio Maffei, e due chef italiani ospiti di Mr.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova a Rye, New York, e incontra chef Rafele Ronca, proprietario del ristorante "Rafele Rye". La giusta occasione per preparare un menù completo tipico del centro e sud Italia. Ornella prosegue la sua visita intervistando chef Ronca, e l'imprenditrice e filantropa americana Annie Mara, nonchè proprietaria dei New York Giants, squadra della N.F.L. (2020)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado nel 2020 festeggia i primi 15 anni di broadcasting su NYC life e Brindiamo! ufficialmente diventa il programma di cucina più longevo del canale. In questa puntata vi presentiamo alcuni dei momenti più belli di questi ultimi anni di produzione alla scoperta della ristorazione italiana ospite della puntata Edoardo Bennato in New York. (2020)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado continua il viaggio dei 15 anni di Brindiamo! con una raccolta di ricette, interviste e storie degli ultimi anni del programma televisivo Brindiamo! opsite di questa puntata Ron a New York. (2020)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado presenta la terza parte del quindicesimo anniversario di Brindiamo! con ricette, interviste e storie, ospite della puntata Raf in Florida. (2020)

programme.desc: Benvenuti a questo nuovo episodio del Circolo dei Buongustai! Cosa bolle in pentola? Oggi il nostro chef Fabio Campoli ci delizierà con tre ricette speciali: rotolo di riso, prosciutto e melone, risotto alla rucola con kiwi e vongole, e budino di riso. Buona visione a tutti!

programme.title: Il CIRCOLO DEL BUONGUSTAI Con Fabio Campoli

programme.title: My Talented Friends Season 1
programme.desc: Ornella Fado introduce il suo amico Geniale Julian Gargiulo, un talentuosissimo compositore e pianista on uno spiccato senso dell'umore, Julian e` il protagnosita e regista di un documentario girato al Carnegie Hall di New York, durante una competizione ideada dal maestro Gargiiulo.

programme.title: My Talented Friends Season 1
programme.desc: Ornella Fado introuce il suo amico Geniale Marco Napoli, attore e regista televisivo e cinematografico. Il documentario di oggi vede come protagonista una giovane artista catanese Roberta Finocchiaro "Save lives with the Rhytm.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado visita cinque amici ristoratori durante le feste Natalizie, prima tappa" Angelina's" a Staten Island, poi e` la volta di "Marco Polo" e "Luzzo" a Brooklyn. A Manhattan nell'Upper East side, Ornella visita "83 e mezza". Ultima tappa per ujn buon gelato,"Dolce Gelateria" nel Village. (2013)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita" Via Oreto", un ristorante dal cuore siciliano. Antony prepara le ricette della nonna e della mamma. Accanto la nonna a visionare tutto. In questo episodio Ornella intervsita un esperto del vino siciliano Pietro Cavallo, e parlano dell'importanza di abbinare il giusto vino ad ogni piatto.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita Gente, dove incontra Jay Mitchel un americano appassionato di Italia al punto di aprire un suo ristorante in america per far apprezzare il cibo Italiano ad i suoi clienti.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado visita il ristorante Barolo, nel cuore di Soho ed incontra il proprietario Paolo Secondo, che oltre a preparare una squsita focaccia Genovese, racconta la sua storia di giovane imprenditore italiano a New York.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage.Ornella Fado, visita il ristorante stellato Cascinale Novo, dove incontra chef Walter Ferreto e preparano delle tipiche ricette Piemontesi. Ornella inoltre visitare la casa del Trifolao di Natale Romagnolo per una caccia al tartufo Bianco.

programme.title: Brindiamo!
programme.desc: Questa puntata fa parte della serie vintage. Ornella Fado, visita il ristorante "etc.etc". nel cuore di Manhattan per preparare le ricette tipiche del ristorante con lo chef Stefano Terzi. In questa puntata l'ospite è il celebre pianista, Giovanni Allevi, reduce da un favoloso concerto al Carnegie Hall. Ornella intervista Giovanni passeggiando in carrozza a Central Park. (2005)

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova nel laboratorio di Urbani Truffle a New York ed invita i suoi amici chef per preparare insieme delle ricette da gustare durante le festività natalizie. In questa puntata Chef Pino Coladonato, Chef Marcello Russodivito e la giovane pizzaiola Giorgia Caporuscio. In questa edizione di Brindiamo! in my Kitchen ospite speciale la soprano Cristina Fontanelli e John La Barbera, oltre a vari ospiti del mondo dello spettacolo, e della moda. (2016)

I suoi amici chef in questa puntata son lo chef Raffaele Ronca, lo Chef Marco Chirico e il giovane pizzaiolo Ettore Toches. In questa edizione di Brindiamo! in my Kitchen la musica è dal vivo con la soprano Cristina Fontanelli ed il compositore Jhon La Barbera, tra gli ospiti di questa puntata il Fashion designer Domenico Vacca. programme.title: Eccellenze Italiane con Piero Muscari intervista a Heinz Beck
programme.desc: Pietro Muscari intervista la regista e sceneggiatrice Lina Wertmüller. Prima donna nella storia ad essere candidata all' Oscar come miglior regista, Lina racconta il suo rapporto con grandi personaggi del cinema come Lelio Luttazzi e Federico Fellini.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado si trova a Roma e visita nel cuore di Roma a Piazza Navona il ristorante stellato "Il Convivio di Troiani" dello Chef Massimo Troiani. Insieme allo Chef Daniele Lippi cucinano dei piatti gustosi, quanto raffinati. Ornella intervista Massimo Troiani e partecipa come "USA Ambassador " alla serata di gala "Eccellenze Italiane" presso "La Pergola" dei Cavalieri Hilton, intervistando Il re degli Chef Heniz Beck.

programme.title: Brindiamo! With Ornella Fado
programme.desc: Ornella Fado presenta una collezione dei suoi drink preferiti preparati durante le registrazioni dei programmi di Brindiamo!

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, visita il ristorante "Angelina's" di Angelina Malerba. Il ristorante si trova a Staten Island un dei 5 distretti di New York, e Angelina afferma: "Qui mi sento come se fossi nella mia amata Sicilia dato che ho il mare di fronte". Con lo chef Marco Zuccalà, Ornella prepara alcune ricette tipiche siciliane.(2010)

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, visita il ristorante stellato "Madonnina del Pescatore", a Senigallia. Insieme a chef Moreno Cedroni preparano delle ricette belle da vedere e deliziose da mangiare.In questa puntata Ornella è ospite all'inaugurazione della cantina di Domodimonti nelle Marche.(2010)

programme.title: BrindiamoS2
programme.desc: Ornella Fado, visita una pizzeria "Olio Pizza e Più" nel Village a Manhattan, dove incontra master pizzaiolo Giulio Adriani, campione mondiale di pizza margherita. Oltre a preparare favole pizze, Ornella incontra Edoardo Bennato all'istituto Italiano di Cultura di New York ed insieme cantano alcuni brani famosissimi. (2010)

programme.title: Brindiamo!
